note.p: Physician. With Sophia Jex Blake fought to study medicine at Edinburgh University, 1872–3. MD, Paris, 1877. Licentiate of the King and Queen’s College of Physicians in Ireland, 1878. Residential medical officer at the Birmingham and Midland Hospital for Women, 1878. Member of the Birmingham Philosophical Society, 1880. Admitted to Holloway Sanatorium, Virginia Water, Surrey, 1895.

Census returns of England and Wales 1861 (The National Archives: Public Record Office RG9/2587/95/30), 1871 (RG10/816/102/43), 1881 (RG11/2956/84/29), 1891 (RG12/564/20/33), 1901 (RG13/1167/105/14), 1911 (RG14/6705/9)
England & Wales, national probate calendar (index of wills and administrations), 1858–1966, 1973–95 (Ancestry.co.uk, accessed 17 September 2018)

Jex-Blake and others v. Senatus Academicus of the University of Edinburgh, and the chancellor thereof: Scottish Court of Session, 27 June 1873 (https://www.casemine.com/judgement/uk/5a8ff82760d03e7f57ebbed6, accessed 17 September 2018)
Surrey, England, admissions to Brookwood and Holloway mental hospitals, 1867–1900 (Ancestry.co.uk, accessed 17 September 2018)
